com.adidas.ui.input

Class InputStep

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adidas.ui.input.InputStep
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleInputStep

    public abstract class InputStep
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class that should be implemented by any InputStep. This input step will be loaded inside a fragment.

      abstract int getMainViewId()

      • onCreateOutOfFocusView

        public abstract android.view.View onCreateOutOfFocusView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                                         android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                                         android.os.Bundle arguments)
        This method will be called if the step requires out of focus mode. If so, the view will be inflated and added to the OutOfFocusStepFragment
        Parameters:
        inflater -
        container -
        Returns:
        The inflated view, or null if not supported

      • getTag

        public abstract java.lang.String getTag()
        Tag needed to be added to the fragment.
        Returns:
        String containing this step tag.

      • getMainViewId

        public abstract int getMainViewId()
        If this step supports out of focus we need to specfy which view will be touched to pass from focus to out of focus. A touch event listener will be added to that view. Both the out of focus view and the focus view should match to have this working corretly.
        Returns:
        The identifier for the view that will listen for touch events.

      • getRootContentViewId

        public int getRootContentViewId()
        As the step needs to be dismissed when touching at some area we allow to the developer to identify which area should listen for touch events for dismiss.
        Returns:
        The identifier for the view that should listen for touch events to dismiss this step.

      • getStringIdForSharedElementTransition

        public abstract int getStringIdForSharedElementTransition()
        If out of focus is enabled we should apply the shared element transition, and for do this we need to have the transition name link.
        Returns:
        The identifier for the transition string.

      • isFocusModeEnabled

        public boolean isFocusModeEnabled()

      • isShowInFocusCycle

        public boolean isShowInFocusCycle(android.os.Bundle arguments)
        Returns:
        true if this step should be shown in focus mode on navigation to the next step
